parameters.definition: Minimum demand of desk-lamps per day
Minimum demand of night-lamps per day
Maximum production of desk-lamps per day
Maximum production of night-lamps per day
Minimum total production of lamps per day to satisfy contract

description: A lighting company makes desk-lamps and night-lamps. There is an expected demand of at least \param{MinDesk} desk-lamps and \param{MinNight} night-lamps each day. However, due to the size of their factory, they can make at most \param{MaxDesk} desk-lamps and \param{MaxNight} night-lamps per day. To satisfy a contract, a minimum of \param{MinTotal} lamps must be made each day. If the profit per desk-lamp sold is \param{ProfitDesk} and the profit per night-lamp sold is \param{ProfitNight}, how many lamps of each type should be made to maximize profit?
